metadata.description:
The Bedouin communities currently living in Israel and the West Bank were originally displaced from their ancestral lands of the Negev desert in 1948. 

Today, the majority of these semi-nomadic communities continue to face displacement, demolition, and forced urbanization. 

Their traditional semi-nomadic lifestyle, 
which is closely tied to the land, 
Is gradually disappearing 
as a result.

+

At 'In This Land,' we are mapping spaces, cultures, and histories that are disappearing in the real world, so they may continue to exist in the collective imaginary. 

We hope to build a web3 future that is equitable, 
and emancipatory, for all.
